title: Spanish Grammar Basics
description: A beginner-friendly introduction to basic Spanish grammar

pages.title: Subject Pronouns in Spanish
pages.description: Learn the basic subject pronouns used in Spanish

data.text:
Spanish subject pronouns are used to indicate who is performing an action:
- Yo = I
- Tú = You (informal)
- Él/Ella/Usted = He/She/You (formal)
- Nosotros/Nosotras = We
- Vosotros/Vosotras = You all (informal, Spain)
- Ellos/Ellas/Ustedes = They/You all (formal)

pages.title: Present Tense of -AR Verbs
pages.description: Learn how to conjugate regular -AR verbs in present tense

data.text:
To conjugate regular -AR verbs, remove -ar and add endings:
- Yo: -o
- Tú: -as
- Él/Ella/Usted: -a
- Nosotros: -amos
- Vosotros: -áis
- Ellos/Ellas/Ustedes: -an

Example with *hablar* (to speak):
Yo hablo, Tú hablas, Él habla, Nosotros hablamos, Vosotros habláis, Ellos hablan
Yo [0] (hablar) español. Tú [1] (trabajar) mucho. Nosotros [2] (estudiar) en casa.

In Spanish, articles match the gender and number of the noun:
- Definite: el (masc. sing), la (fem. sing), los (masc. pl), las (fem. pl)
- Indefinite: un (masc. sing), una (fem. sing), unos (masc. pl), unas (fem. pl)

pages.title: Basic Sentence Structure
pages.description: Learn how to form basic affirmative sentences

data.text:
In Spanish, the basic sentence structure is:
Subject + Verb + Object
Example: Yo como una manzana. (I eat an apple.)
Tú lees un libro. Nosotros comemos arroz. Ellos viven en Madrid.

pages.description: Review what you've learned with a mix of exercises
